intro: Sannantha procera, commonly known as the tall sannantha, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Sannantha procera is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops.
